page.title: 06The Botanic Gardens
page.content: The{Botanic Gardens}was once the Royal National Hospital for Diseases of the Chest.The gardens,one of the finest in the country, is a big tourist attraction as it contains more than 10,000 plants including many rare and beautiful species used to a warmer climate. There are{banana trees}which unfortunately were badly hit by the unusually severe winter of 1984/85, however, there is evidence of a new growth of about five young trees again. There are also{camellias}and{ {Yuccas}and Lord Mountbatten planted a very special oak tree here. A pretty gold-fish pond with a fountain and water-lilies is in the middle of a lovely rose garden. There is a cafe here, and overlooking the rose garden, is the hospital library now housing a gift shop. Further along is an adventure playground.
